intro: Funkiella durangensis subsp. tenella, commonly known as the Durango funkiella, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the mountainous regions of Durango, Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high elevations, showcasing adaptations to its harsh environment. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in its native range.
